column4: Ok Ive got one of my HDs mounted but it's permissions are listed as root. I did sudo chown -hR brandon:brandon /media/disk, but it didnt change the permissions. What do I need to do?
what filesystem does that disk have?
and you dont get any errors? is the drive mounted read+write and not readonly? check mount|grep /media/disk for "ro" or "rw"
sounds like black magic is involved
I just did the same on /dev/hdf1 also, which is the dev of the HD
have you tried that chown under sudo su - ? dont think it makes a difference, but... atleast it should show you errors if it didn't work
I did sudo -s and switched to root, then did the chown
I'll umount and remount to test
you dont have a user set in the mount options, do you? ;)
I just remounted using sudo mount and the perms are assigned to me, not root
so I guess whatever I did worked
